thread.title: People's Choice Awards 2017 worst dressed - from Kristen Bell to Gwen Stefani and Jodie Sweetin
thread.title_full: People's Choice Awards 2017 worst dressed - from Kristen Bell to Gwen Stefani and Jodie Sweetin

author: Zoe Shenton
title: People's Choice Awards 2017 worst dressed - from Kristen Bell to Gwen Stefani and Jodie Sweetin
text:
Thank you for subscribing!   
The who's who of the acting world turned out for the People's Choice Awards in Los Angeles on Wednesday. 
And while the red carpet was awash with plenty of gorgeous, head-turning gowns, some stars stood out for all the wrong reasons. 
Kristen Bell, Yara Shahidi, Gwen Stefani, Jodie Sweetin, Melissa McCarthy and Candace Cameron Bure all wore looks that failed to set the red carpet at the Microsoft Theatre alight. 
Gwen Stefani tops this year's worst dressed list as she seriously missed the fashion mark in a clown-inspired ruffled blue dress with a cut-out panel on the tummy. 
Making the look even less desirable, Gwen opted to team the look with fishnet tights. Recording artist/TV personality Gwen Stefani (Photo: Getty Images North America) Kristen Bell (Photo: Rex Features) 
Kristen Bell's metallic silver jumpsuit swallowed up her slight frame and the white cups didn't add anything to the look. 
Fuller House star Jodie Sweetin also proved that her sense of style could do with a helping hand. 
Her look failed to flatter as she tried to team feminine with edgy, paring a leather jacket with a patterned frock with puffy skirt. 
And American actress Yara Shahidi's monochrome ensemble made her look a little like a chess board, while Chris Sullivan proved that less can definitely be more with his eye-watering outfit. Melissa McCarthy (Photo: Rex Features) Chris Sullivan (Photo: Rex Features) 
On the night, a whopping 64 categories were up for grabs, with the main nominees being Captain America: Civil War, which topped the nods with seven. 
While in TV, Grey's Anatomy led the nominations with five. 
The Great Indoors star Joel McHale hosted the annual bash which saw presenters like Jamie Chung, Jordana Brewster, and Wilmer Valderrama take to the stage. Like us on Facebook
